Regarding your second question, you can add textviews dynamically to a relative layout by using a for loop and the layout inflater. You can set the layout parameters for each textview and add it to the relative layout. Here's an example:

<<<code>>>: for(int i = 0; i < alist.size(); i++){
LayoutInflater inflater = (LayoutInflater) getSystemService(Context.LAYOUT_INFLATER_SERVICE);
TextView textview = (TextView) inflater.inflate(R.layout.tag_keyword,null);
textview.setText(alist.get(i));
textview.setId(2000 + i);
RelativeLayout.LayoutParams rlp = new RelativeLayout.LayoutParams(RelativeLayout.LayoutParams.WRAP_CONTENT, RelativeLayout.LayoutParams.WRAP_CONTENT);
rlp.addRule(RelativeLayout.ALIGN_PARENT_TOP);
rlp.addRule(RelativeLayout.ALIGN_PARENT_LEFT);
fl.addView(textview, rlp);
}

You can adjust the layout parameters and the position of the textviews as per your requirement.
